User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Macintosh; Intel Mac OS X 10.6; rv:2.0b9) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b9

Some (many?) Firefox users have a ton of tabs open, effectively using them as lightweight bookmarks; this behavior is going to become more common with Panorama. However, sometimes a session will crash, and will have a tab or tabs that are just too crashy for Firefox to restore. With many tabs open, it's frustrating to lose all context upon starting a new session or try to divine which tab is the problematic one. Being able to bookmark all of the tabs in the previous session when starting a new session would allow users to quickly start a new session and get back to work while still being able to restore tabs from the previous session if they turn out to be required later on.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Load a ton of tabs
2. Crash Firefox a couple of times
3. Try to bookmark all of the tabs from the session
Actual Results:  
You can't bookmark the tabs.

Expected Results:  
One click to bookmark the tabs.

comments.text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Probably a wontfix but I'll leave it open for something to look at again
> post-firefox4

Just my 2-cents.  Considering we have "Bookmark All Tabs" in the tab-bar context menu, I think it's completely reasonable from users to expect the same functionality from everywhere their tabs exist (Session Store and Panorama).

I'm not saying it's a feature I'd ever use, but I can see that some people might want this feature.

This might be a good candidate bug for some avid add-on developer to tackle.
